spec.name: Al Khawarizmy High School
spec.description: Al Khawarizmy High School, formerly known as 'l'INDUS' (the Industrial and Commercial School of Casablanca), is considered the oldest high school in the city. Inaugurated in 1917 during the French Protectorate, the school was historically a prestigious institution, attracting the country's top mathematics students and training a significant portion of the Moroccan elite in technical and scientific fields. Its long history and architectural significance led to its classification as a National Material Patrimony site in 2004.

timeline.title: School Inauguration
timeline.description: The school, originally the Industrial and Commercial School of Casablanca, was inaugurated, making it the oldest high school in Casablanca.

timeline.title: Centennial Celebration
timeline.description: The high school celebrated its 100th anniversary.

timeline.title: National Material Patrimony Declaration
timeline.description: The building was officially declared a part of the National Material Patrimony of Morocco.
